holidays.name: Wright Brothers Day
holidays.description: Celebrating the pioneering achievements of Orville and Wilbur Wright, marking the anniversary of their first successful powered flight in 1903.
holidays.origin: Established in the U.S. in 1959 to honor the brothers' contribution to aviation on the date of the first flight.
holidays.funFact: Their first flight lasted only 12 seconds and covered just 120 feet, but it changed the world forever!

holidays.name: National Maple Syrup Day
holidays.description: A delicious day dedicated to appreciating the sweet, sticky syrup made from the sap of maple trees.
holidays.origin: An unofficial food holiday celebrated mainly in North America where maple syrup production is a proud tradition.
holidays.funFact: It takes about 40 gallons of maple sap to make just 1 gallon of pure maple syrup ‚Äî talk about sweetness concentration!

holidays.name: Ugly Sweater Day
holidays.description: A festive day to don the tackiest, most outrageous holiday sweaters you can find or create.
holidays.origin: Became popular with quirky Christmas parties in the early 2000s and now a widespread fun tradition around December.
holidays.funFact: The ugly holiday sweater trend started as a joke but now some sweaters can sell for hundreds of dollars as collector's items!

holidays.name: National Chocolate-Covered Anything Day
holidays.description: An excuse to dunk or coat literally anything edible in chocolate and enjoy the sweet, creamy goodness.
holidays.origin: An unofficial food holiday encouraging sweet creativity and indulgence, celebrated especially by chocoholics worldwide.
holidays.funFact: Chocolate-covered bacon has been one of the strangest but surprisingly popular chocolate-covered treats embraced on this day!
